And here we need your support to help us to bring this to the world.
THE BIG, EXCITING PICTURE - A FREE, GLOBAL LIBRARY OF WEBSITES: The Library of Congress meets Pinterest!
What would you get if you merged the Library of Congress and Pinterest?  That's what this campaign is about!
WebHub.mobi is a new social network of libraries of websites, offering public and private libraries of websites for free to anyone with a browser.

This campaign is to build features into the library that allow private users globally to share their own groups of favorite sites on any subject as part of the library for the benefit of everyone. This means that WebHub helps you find the best groupings of websites for what you want, based on what other people with similar interests have added to the library.  And, you and your network will also be able to share groups of websites privately, giving you another channel for finding the best sites for what you are interested in.

WebHub works a little like Pinterest. In Pinterest, people pin images of things on the Web that they like into groups they create called ""boards.'  In WebHub, people gather websites into groups they like in their own private libraries.  WebHub also has a public library of websites that immediately available to everyone.

For books, public libraries are one of humanity's greatest achievements, such as, the ancient Library of Alexandria (now re-constructed), the Library of Congress, the New York Public Library and all the local public libraries in cities and towns around the world.

Websites are a version of books.  Just like books, websites cover a vast range of subject matter, providing users with expanded knowledge, information and entertainment on almost every imaginable subject from almost everywhere in the world.

Just like books, websites deserve a library, where they can be collected, indexed, annotated, searched and shared, just like a library of books.  However, there is no simple system for cataloging and organizing websites by groups so that they are easy to find and use from any device, especially mobile.  Search engines offer individual people one-off searches, and bookmarking and favorites work up to a point for some individuals.

That is what is so exciting about this campaign: help build this global library of websites from where it is now into a social network that lets anyone, anywhere in the world add to the library for everyone's benefit.

What if there was a core, free public library with a very simple indexing system that was designed from the start to make mobile browsing easy across a huge range of websites and across all types of devices that people now use to surf the Web, and to expand all of our Web horizons? That's what we've started at www.webhub.mobi.
The user interface system is designed to work as easily (and identically) on small touchscreens on smartphones as on the larger screens of ereaders, tablets, laptops and pcs.

Using a simple system of Hubs, Categories and Links, our library system can catalog and index the whole Web, and give people a fast, easy access to a huge range of websites.  ""Hubs"" are at the highest level of organization.  Each ""Hub"" has a set of ""Categories"".  Each combination of Hub and Category, has a set of associated websites in what we call ""Link"" keys.

For instance, in WebHub's public library now, there are ""Hubs"" for Art, Education, News, Travel, Philanthropy, Humor, Literature and many more.  In, Travel Hub, there are ""Categories"" for Airlines, Hotels, Cars, Travel Portals, etc.  In Art Hub, there are ""Categories"" for Art Events, Art News, Museums by city around the world, etc.  In Music Hub, there are multiple categories, and the websites in the categories include major streaming sits such as Rhapsody, Lastfm, Spotify, 8tracks, etc as well as Music Blogs and more, each with a quick description.
For each website in the WebHub library, there is a common name, a URL, a set of tags and a short text description.

This means that just by choosing a Hub in a general area of interest, the user can access groups of websites organized by Category, and each website is carefully annotated so the user knows what it is about before the user clicks through to the site.

In addition to the WebHub public library, WebHub lets users create their own private libraries where users can build their own, private groups of indexed and organized websites.  The private libraries have many features.  For example: (1) users can create guest password which let other people visit (but not edit) that user's private library
column2: (2) users can store their usernames and passwords for each site in their private library
column3: and (3) users can keep notes specific to each site in their library and notes that apply across all their private library.

column1: The guest feature in private libraries is the beginnings of the WebHub social network of libraries of websites that this campaign will take to the next level.
WATCH VIDEOS ABOUT THE LIBRARY'S CURRENT FEATURES

You can learn more about the currently released features of WebHub by visiting the website, and by going to the WebHub youtube channel which has a series of quick tutorial and informational videos at www.youtube.com/user/webhubdotmobi.
THE CAMPAIGN - THE FEATURES YOU CAN HELP US BUILD

This campaign is to extend the feature set of WebHub's public and private libraries in a very powerful and exciting way.  Here's the big picture idea: what if any individual anywhere in the world can help grow the scope of the library by contributing some or all of his/her private library to the public, shared library?

Think of it!  People everywhere have specific areas of interest and expertise where they know the top websites that appy to those areas.  They have done the hard work of finding and selecting the best websites in their areas of interest.  With the feature set funded by this campaign, users can, if they want, share some or all of this collection of websites with the rest of us, enriching everybody.

For instance, a person in Europe may have a collection of the leading, local independent newspaper websites in cities across Europe.  A person in India may know the best set of Indian cultural websites.  A person in Brazil may know the leading soccer websites in Brazil.  A person in the US may know the leading country music websites.  A person in Indonesia may know the key local sites covering education in Indonesia.

Right now, all of us separately have to expend a significant amount of time and energy searching and culling through the Web to find and compile the best group of sites on any subject.  We want to extend WebHub, with your help, into a social network that allows each of us to add to the public library with our own knowledge of the best grouping of websites, and that allows each of us to benefit from the knowledge and work of others who choose to add to the library.  In this way, vast new areas of the Web will become instantly available to everyone, rather than just the few websites we tend to visit regularly and those that we each individually go through all the effort of searching for each time we think of something we might want or need on the web.

This is especially relevant and timely as (1) more and more people around the world add content to the web, and (2) search engines become more and more focused on delivering results based on personal profiles and the location the user is searching from.
WHAT YOUR HELP WILL ENABLE US TO DO
We need funding to develop and release the features that allow us to build social sharing features into WebHub making it a true, global community effort and value.

That's the purpose and excitement of this campaign:  create a truly global library system that leverages the knowledge and private expertise of people around the world of the Web to expand all of our web experiences easily to every corner of the Web from any of our devices.
The specific set of features this campaign will fund are:

1.  The ability for users who have created private libraries to identify some or all of their private library to contribute to the public, shared library for others to access, and as part of that identification process, to add a text description of the group of sites the user is sharing, as well as tags.

2.  The ability for users of the public and private libraries to search the public, shared library of websites, including the groupings added by other users.  The search will include various filters, such as a filter for highly rated private user additions, and a filter for search for exact text matches of just URLs.
3.  The ability of private users to import into their private library groupings that they find and like.
3.  The ability for users to rate the groupings shared by other private users.
4.  The ability for users to make some or all of their private library shareable within only a select group of other private users.
WHEN WILL THESE NEW FEATURES BE READY FOR EVERYONE TO USE?

Based on our experience developing WebHub to date and our assessment of the development time for these features, we are targeting that these features will be ready about three-to-four months after we receive the funding we need from this campaign.  This gives us time to do careful development and careful testing so that all these new features work properly when we release them publicly.

We would be happy to hear from any of you who would like to participate as responsible beta testers at the appropriate time in the development cycle, who we can give early access to features for purposes of kicking the tires in all the different contexts in which the libraries need to work (smartphones, touchscreens, tablets, various operating systems, various browsers, etc).

We are a dynamic, small team of people who have been working together to build WebHub.  The inventor, designer and team leader is Tim Higginson who is based near Chicago.  He has a background in technology innovation, software development and project management.  One of Tim's grandfathers (Dr. Andrew D. Osborn) was a professional librarian who worked at leading libraries (including the library system of the University of Sydney, Australia
column2: the New York Public Library and Harvard University's libraries), and who was instrumental in the design of modern public and university library systems.  Tim's LinkedIn page is provided as a link as part of the campaign information. Other members of the team include superb software and relational database experts based near San Francisco and Chicago, including:  Eric Glover in Chicago and Heath Carlisle of Brown Barn Studios near San Francisco.

column1: This team has successfully built WebHub's free public and private libaries of websites, including all their current features, that you can use now at www.webhub.mobi.  We have the track record to achieve the goals of this campaign.  We believe the major technical challenges we face will be in the areas of pushing the envelope in terms of what we are doing with relational databases that underpin the library system, and in terms of the user interface that presents the library content to users in a simple, uniform way that is easy to use across devices and browsers, and whether from a touchscreen or a device with a keyboard and mouse or touchpad.  We have analyzed these challenges, and are ready to start developing these features in a careful and robust process when we start receiving funding through this campaign.
We are offering exciting perks.  The perks all relate in various ways to the WebHub ""Library of Websites"".

We will make supporters ""patrons"" of the library, and place a graphical ""patron medallion"" that will appear next to the WebHub logo every time that supporer logs into their own private WebHub.  In that way, our supporters will know by the medallion that they have been a founding patron of the first global library of websites.  We will also create a ""patron wall"" page on the WebHub website, and include names of patrons (or ""anonymous"" if a patron prefers that).  These are to thank our supporters and recognize them privately and publicly for being a patron of the arts and libraries.
At each contribution level, we have a physical item that we can mail to supporters if a supporter wants something physical and in addition to the medallions and patron wall recognition.

For our highest level supporters, we will create positions on a ""library advisory board"" along with our senior team.  We will keep the library advisory board up-to-date on planning, and we will seek advice and recommendations from the board regarding WebHub on an on-going basis.  We are limiting this support level to 4 positions, so this is perfect for instance for four friends who want to participate together on this WebHub ""library advisory board.""
WHAT WE WILL DO IF WE GET LESS THAN THE WHOLE GOAL

We have built WebHub on a rolling basis.  Our roadmap for WebHub is divided into ""priority groups.""  With funds that are less than the whole goal of this campaign, we will execute on as many individual priority groups as the funding permits.  We are great at achieving a lot on a little.

The impact of a global library of websites with the critical search and social sharing features that are the focus of this campaign is extraordinary.  The goal is to provide people worldwide with the ability to share, find and import groups of websites on virtually any topic from anywhere in the world.  This can revolutionize the scope, speed and ease of everyone's access to the most interesting websites from around the world, expanding all of our Web horizons.
There are many ways you can help a lot.  Of course, funding is a top priority!  You can also help the Library grow, whether or not you contribute cash, when you:
(1)  Go to www.webhub.mobi (from your smartphone, tablet, ereader, laptop or pc), learn how it works and try it for yourself.
(2)  Become a registered user of WebHub, learn about all the features that are already available in for private library users, and build your own private library.
(3)  Start sharing your private library with your friends using the guest password feature.
(4)  Act as an ambassador for WebHub by spreading the word about WebHub and this campaign.  Indiegogo has great tools for spreading the word.

We are offering exciting perks.  The perks all relate in various ways to the WebHub ""Library of Websites"".

We will make supporters ""patrons"" of the library, and place a graphical ""patron medallion"" that will appear next to the WebHub logo every time that supporer logs into their own private WebHub.  In that way, our supporters will know by the medallion that they have been a founding patron of the first global library of websites.  We will also create a ""patron wall"" page on the WebHub website, and include names of patrons (or ""anonymous"" if a patron prefers that).  These are to thank our supporters and recognize them privately and publicly for being a patron of the arts and libraries.
At each contribution level, we have a physical item that we can mail to supporters if a supporter wants something physical and in addition to the medallions and patron wall recognition.

For our highest level supporters, we will create positions on a ""library advisory board"" along with our senior team.  We will keep the library advisory board up-to-date on planning, and we will seek advice and recommendations from the board regarding WebHub on an on-going basis.  We are limiting this support level to 4 positions, so this is perfect for instance for four friends who want to participate together on this WebHub ""library advisory board.""
WHAT WE WILL DO IF WE GET LESS THAN THE WHOLE GOAL

We have built WebHub on a rolling basis.  Our roadmap for WebHub is divided into ""priority groups.""  With funds that are less than the whole goal of this campaign, we will execute on as many individual priority groups as the funding permits.  We are great at achieving a lot on a little.

The impact of a global library of websites with the critical search and social sharing features that are the focus of this campaign is extraordinary.  The goal is to provide people worldwide with the ability to share, find and import groups of websites on virtually any topic from anywhere in the world.  This can revolutionize the scope, speed and ease of everyone's access to the most interesting websites from around the world, expanding all of our Web horizons.
There are many ways you can help a lot.  Of course, funding is a top priority!  You can also help the Library grow, whether or not you contribute cash, when you:
(1)  Go to www.webhub.mobi (from your smartphone, tablet, ereader, laptop or pc), learn how it works and try it for yourself.
(2)  Become a registered user of WebHub, learn about all the features that are already available in for private library users, and build your own private library.
(3)  Start sharing your private library with your friends using the guest password feature.
(4)  Act as an ambassador for WebHub by spreading the word about WebHub and this campaign.  Indiegogo has great tools for spreading the word.",0.0,0,"1 Campaign

Isowalk is the world's first intelligent walking assistant. It replaces primitive canes with modern technology that's been designed from the ground up to adapt itself to each individual user and actively help them walk.

A breakthrough in personal mobility, Isowalk combines the best of modern ergonomics, orthopedics, biomechanics, aerospace engineering and aesthetic design. Isowalk's innovations have already been awarded two U.S. patents.
Our goal: Help millions of people walk.
We believe Isowalk is already the world's best walking assistant, even while it's still in beta.

With your help, we will tool and manufacture the first Isowalks in volume and make this revolutionary mobility aid available to the world. Contributors will be first to get one, of course -- for themselves or a loved one.
With a successful campaign, we will also deploy the digital intelligence (see below) that will make Isowalk a wireless 'smart object' for digital health and security applications.

Should we be lucky enough to exceed our goal, we'd use your generous support to make more Isowalks, of course.  But you'll also be helping accelerate our plans for specialized models for every kind of user, application and budget, including seniors, athletics, recovery, obesity and pediatrics.
We believe that everyone who needs or wants this technology should have it.
The most common walking aid is the cane, which is very likely the world's oldest technology. It actually shows up in Egyptian hieroglyphics and has barely changed for thousands of years.

In terms of ergonomics and usability (not to mention looks!), canes are an epic fail, which is why virtually everyone hates to use one. They're uncomfortable, painful, awkward -- the ultimate 'dumb' device. A cane doesn't help you walk. Its real purpose is to keep you from falling.
Isowalk (finally) applies modern principles and technologies to walking assistance.  Here's how this revolutionary device takes us beyond today's crude canes and sticks:
Isowalk already has native biomechanical intelligence that will be built into every model.  But the fun really starts as we begin to add digital intelligence for Isowalk Connected.

Advances in low-power wireless technologies (Bluetooth, ANT+, Z-Wave, etc.) and similar advances in touch and pressure sensitive materials open a tremendous range of smart applications for Isowalk in the Internet of Things. Possibilities include real-time and archived progress feedback, location detection, and interaction with motion sensors at home or away.

We've already identified several of the most appropriate wireless solutions that are practical for these kinds of applications.  Our team is connected to extensive leading-edge expertise in wireless technologies, as well as a world-class testing facility.

With a successful campaign, we will not only launch the first Isowalks to the market, we'll also select the winning digital platform(s) and build the initial edition of the first Isowalk Connected models.

Isowalk is a bootstrapped startup, seeded by a core group of friends and family and spearheaded by me - Ron Goldberg.  I'm a 25-year consumer technologies veteran and ninja innovator and have a long history of helping to launch new technologies into the world.

If you know me (hi!), you already know the kinds of people and organizations that I work with.  If you don't know me, a look at my LinkedIn or Facebook page gives you some background. With a bit of trawling, you can also see my profile at the Innovation Movement.

Through my longtime work in the consumer electronics industry, I'm privileged to work closely with some of its most renowned experts in hardware, software and manufacturing. These friends and colleagues make up Isowalk's enviable collective expertise, giving their time, talent and experience because they believe deeply in this project. You can read more about them in our FAQ below.
As for the rest of our core team, they are fellow visionaries that have brought Isowalk to life with funding, sweat, time, thoughtfulness and discounted invoices.
Isowalk is a startup, but we are by no means rookies at bringing out new technologies. Far from it.
Let's face it, no matter what shape you're in or how old you are, nobody wants to think about walking assistance. I know I didn't, until I watched my own parents struggle in their final years.
Then I started seeing the problem everywhere.
Athletic friends hobbling with a stick. Boomer friends too self conscious to use a stick. Older people not walking enough because their stick not only doesn't help, it hurts.

You've probably never thought about it either. That is, unless -- or maybe until, because life happens -- you or someone you love wants or needs the help. Nobody thinks about any of this. Until it's needed.
When it is, all that's really available to you is a cane. Whether it's a plain one or a fancy one, a folding one or a gimmicky one, a cane is still literally as dumb as a stick.
Always uncomfortable. Usually ugly. Never actively assistive. Outside of color and other minor variations, there's virtually no difference between any of them.

It's 2013 and we're all still stuck with a stick. Why?  Easy -- they cost almost nothing to make and are extremely profitable for big companies that sell many millions of them around the world, year in and year out.
When not bothering to innovate is so easy and profitable, who wants to do it?

We bet you like helping people as much as we do. And by helping to launch Isowalk, you'll be helping a lot of people. Your contribution to this visionary product makes you a visionary too, and vision has its perks.
We'll be offering Isowalks, of course. We'll also be offering cool stuff ranging from always-welcome T-shirts, to files you can use in a 3D printer to accessorize your Isowalk!
Contributors will be making Isowalk happen. You (or a loved one!) get one first!
Print your own individual 3D ornaments for your Isowalk!
Sport the latest in ambulation fashion!
Sip in style, and vote for the contributor's slogan!
Be inside every Isowalk Connected from now on...
One day, all canes will work like this.

Check out the perks, we hope you like them!  Contributors that help launch Isowalk can be the first owners of revolutionary technology that's sure to become collectable, and have their name, in digital ones and zeroes, inside of every connected Isowalk from now on.
We hope you'll support us here on Indiegogo and we look forward to keeping you updated!
We're in the home stretch of this project. Our prototypes have electrified everyone who's seen and used them. Here's how we'll use your generous contributions:

Our team, including myself (see FAQ below). has decades of A-list experience in bringing new tech products to market. We have complete confidence in our ability to bring out Isowalk and will keep contributors closely updated on our continual progress!
We sincerely hope you'll help us bring this groundbreaking technology to the many millions of people worldwide who have been waiting for just such a thing.
Thanks for reading, and thanks for your support!
If you like what you see, please share our campaign with your friends and networks!
What makes Isowalk so different than a cane?
Isowalk adapts to the user, instead of the user adapting to the cane. A cane keeps you from falling, while Isowalk helps you walk.

If you've ever used one, you probably wouldn't ask. Simply put, they hurt. They focus the user's weight on some of the most fragile parts of the body. They force the hand, wrist and arm into weak, unnatural positions with poor leverage. The shoulder, back and neck try to compensate, causing associated strains.
Is Isowalk safer than a cane?

Canes are frequently quite dangerous, mostly because of unpredictable ground contact. About 47k Americans are treated in emergency rooms each year after falling from their walker or cane. Isowalk's tip has triple the ground contact area of a conventional cane tip.
Mostly composite materials like carbon fiber and various urethanes that have been selected for their strength and lightweight characteristics.

Isowalk was designed with the participation of three of the most renowned orthopedic surgeons in their field, in the largest metropolitan center in the US. Confidentiality has been requested until Isowalk is on the market.
Is Isowalk a medical device that needs FDA approval?
No. The FDA classifies this as a ""Class I"" (general controls) device that does not require any special pre-market approvals or regulation.

Isowalk's brain trust is made up of veterans representing numerous avenues of the technology world. Sensitivities with their day gigs prevent any direct shout outs here, but to brag a little, Isowalk's manufacturing guru has brought literally millions of home and personal tech products to market, including numerous best-sellers. Our wireless guru is one of the most eminent figures in the US smart home market. Our visual ID guru's work has won over 250 awards. Our acting CFO has 25 years of experience, etc. We are a startup with tons of experience and long success records.
What about all these smart apps?
We see Isowalk as 'wearable technology' that the user doesn't have to wear. A smart Isowalk can monitor biometric data such as cardiovascular levels
column2: progressive data like distance and recovery
column3: location data (did Grandpa wander off?) and more. A mobility aid is arguably the most natural and least intrusive 'node' for real-time wellness and status in digital health applications. My own professional work is deeply connected to the enabling technologies for these smart apps in the residential, institutional and commercial markets.

column1: We have not settled on a final list price, this will emerge as we finish our final tweaks and costings. We intend for Isowalk to be an accessible technology for everyone. While there will eventually be different Isowalk models at different price points, our first models will be premium facing. The campaign is meant to also cover our tooling expenses, which is why we appreciate your support at the $125 perk 'cost'.
Will Isowalk come in different colors?

As we grow, we will offer Isowalk in a variety of colors and styles, including on-demand customizations. Our initial cosmetics will be close in style and spirit to the beta models seen in our campaign page and gallery.
What will you do with my contribution if you don't reach your funding goal?
We will use all contributions here on Indiegogo to further Isowalk's march to general availability, regardless of sum.
What will you do if you exceed your funding goal?

We will gratefully and enthusiastically accelerate production, begin development of specialized models, start offering colors and customizations, and launch more apps for the connected models. We will also begin plans for a philanthropic arm.
Our target date for a public debut is early January of 2014 at the annual Consumer Electronics Show. Isowalks should be ready to ship to contributors 45-60 days from that event.
Isowalk is a product of Kineticane, LLC, which is the original name we went by and the one you'll see when you make your contribution.
We think Isowalk is an idea that the whole world will want to know about.  If you like what you see please share our campaign through your own networks and Indiegogo's sharing tool!

column11: >It is an exclusive Indiegogo sales event offered only on select sites.

column14: >DUE TO RECENT DEMAND FOR AN AFFORDABLE OUTDOOR SECURITY CAMERA

column9: >This is the very first weather-resistant remotely controlled outdoor camera that lets you monitor the outside of your home from anywhere in the world.

column2: >The iSensor HD Patio Edition gives you the ability to monitor your home’s surroundings from anywhere in the world at any time.  If suspicious activity were to take place, it will inform you instantly with notifications, snapshots, and HD quality videos which are automatically uploaded to your Google Drive for FREE! Set it up in under 1-minute and let the iSensor HD Patio Edition scare off intruders before they even think about entering your home.
column3:
>


Previous Comments:

column2: >At Amaryllo, we design, test, and assemble all our products and accessories.  Over the past few months, we've been trying to improve the robustness of the casing for the iSensor HD.
>All Patio editions will be pre-sealed at our facilities before shipment.
>*Although possible, we urge you not to open the casing as it may compromise the gaskets and rubber seals resulting in leakage.

column1: In the video below, you can see a couple of tests we conducted on the water resistant capabilities of the iSensor HD.  We had no leakage at all on our final tests and feel very comfortable with going into production very soon.
In the video below, we test the functionality of the iSensor HD in extreme cold.  We concluded that the cold has little to no effect on the ability to pan nor does it affect the video quality.
The iSensor HD is the world's smallest remote control home security camera!

column5: >

column18: > updates you with what's happening on the outside of your home.  Keeping an eye on your front door, pool, garden, or even watching over your pets has never been easier!

column3: >Warnings Lights, Alarms, HD Video, Free Cloud Storage, 240° Viewing, and a Weather-Resistant Exterior,

column2: >The iSensor HD Patio is just what you're looking for!

column1: The iSensor HD can be remotely panned 170° via your mobile device, and together with a 70° lens, it has a 240° range of view with no distortion.
iSensor HD Patio has built-in motion and audio sensors. Once triggered, it will automatically send you a push text and/or push picture alert.
The push messages include a time stamp, so you know exactly when the alert was triggered.
After selecting one of the push notifications on the phone as shown above, you will be redirected to our application where you will see the chosen snapshot, as shown below.
After exiting out of the snapshot, you will see a chronological history of all your snapshot alerts, as shown below.
Here's a still image of another iSensor HD placed inside a restaurant.  As you can see, the image keeps its integrity without visual distortion.
You can view this camera at www.live.amaryllo.eu
Below are screeshots of our competitor's HD cameras.

Some are very heavily distorted, like the one below.  The reason for this is because most cameras are fixed and don't pan.  So in order to maximize the viewing area with a ""fish-eye"" lens, image quality must be sacraficed.

column4: >This one is better than the last, however you can still see lines that are distorted when they should be straight.  The contrast is also not right.

column1: The screenshot below, also has heavy distortion and color issues.
Finally, below there are quite a few things that are inferior to Amaryllo products.
1. The frames per second is at 3! This means the stream will be extremely choppy, and the lag time will be unbearable.
2. The contrast is all wrong.  It looks black and white even in a completely lit environment.
3. The lens angle is very narrow.
The Patio edition comes standard with a 4GB built in memory, however we decided to upgrade it to 32GB for our super early backers and to 16GB for our early backers.
An optional ultra-high powered white LED light warns intruders that they are being watched and also provides extra light to capture the image of the culprit
1. For viewing your personal cameras via PC

Below are screenshots of the ""my private cameras"" page which allows you to access all your cameras via PC.  Even the 2way audio, alerts, remote control, and other functions are available through Amaryllo Live.
Below is an example of how you can view all your cameras at once on Amaryllo Live.  Previously, features like these were only available for expensive professional security systems.
2. For sharing cameras with the public
Below are examples of the public channels available at Amaryllo Live

Below is a screenshot of a local restaurant that has a public camera.  You can follow, like, and share any public camera on social media.  On the right side you'll see a chat section where you can ask questions and make comments.
Below is a snap shot of that same restaurant seen on a 24"" screen.

column7: >Below is a video showing how
column12: > you can move the camera in any direction.
column18: > It's super convenient and easy to control.

column1: Feel free to try out Amaryllo Live on your own PC with Firefox browser:

column2:
>The latest in P2P connectivity...

Amaryllo is the first company to integrate Google's browser-based real time communication service into actual products. WebRTC offers extremely stable audio and video streaming without the need of downloading software add-ons or plug-ins.

column1: Amaryllo is also the first company to offer free cloud storage to consumers.
Through the application, you can link your Google Drive to your camera.
Although the video is stored in your drive, you can manage and access them right through the app.  This saves you time and energy when searching for a video.
We have filed close to 20 patents to protect our designs and technologies.  Below is the iSensor HD's industry design patent granted by 26 European countries and the United States of America.

column3: >

column1: Amaryllo products were chosen out of 20,000 to win an innovation award in the embedded technology category.

column2: >Amaryllo was selected as a Cool Vendor by Gartner in their 2014 Connected Home Report . Gartner is the world's biggest
column11: by Info"">investment

column3: >The iSensor HD was the recipient of a Best Choice Award at Computex 2014.

column1: Amaryllo is the recipient of the 2015 WebRTC World Product of the Year Award.
The iCamPRO FHD is the World's First Domestic Robot With Auto-Tracking
We plan to have the setup procedure for the iSensor HD Patio the same as all our other products.
The whole process takes only 1 minute if you know your WiFi password.  Our app will guide you through the steps with a simple QR code scan.
Here is the instructional video for the iSensor HD:
What is the quality of the video?
The quality comes in HD, VGA or QVGA.
For recorded videos it depends on what quality you want the camera to use. This can easily be changed in the settings menu.

For the live viewing, the camera will automatically select the most appropriate quality based on your wifi bandwidth availability.  It will also adjust the quality to make sure the connection is stable and has minimal delay.
Is there a warranty and user manual?
Yes, there is a paper manual that helps you through the setup procedures, but the digital user manual covers all other questions.
We offer warranty on parts for one year after purchase.
What kind of WiFi connection speed do I need?
Our Cameras have built-in WiFi 802.11 bgn and both downloading and uploading speeds depend on your available bandwidth.
For HD, a minimum bandwidth of 1.7Mbps is recommended.

We care about your privacy protection and that is why we employ 256-bit encryption, which is the same level of security as used by NSA, NASA, the Pentagon. With 256 bit encryption and Google's security network, AES permits the use of 256-bit keys. Breaking a symmetric 256-bit key by brute force requires 2128 times more computational power than a 128-bit key. 50 supercomputers that could check a billion billion (1018) AES keys per second (if such a device could ever be made) would, in theory, require about 3×1051 years to exhaust the 256-bit key space.
And you can rest assured that something like this doesn't happen with our camera's.
We designed the Patio specifically for outdoor use.  We've done extensive waterproofing tests as well as temperature tests in less than -20°C and the iSensor continues to function properly.
*See videos of waterproof and temperature tests in the story above!
No, it doesn't have IR LEDs due to it's size.  It does feature an ultra high powered flashlight which will help distinguish objects and deter intruders.
We recommend that you place the device in an area with existing patio lights.

column1: It is an exclusive Indiegogo sales event offered only on select sites.
DUE TO RECENT DEMAND FOR AN AFFORDABLE OUTDOOR SECURITY CAMERA
This is the very first weather-resistant remotely controlled outdoor camera that lets you monitor the outside of your home from anywhere in the world.

The iSensor HD Patio Edition gives you the ability to monitor your home’s surroundings from anywhere in the world at any time.  If suspicious activity were to take place, it will inform you instantly with notifications, snapshots, and HD quality videos which are automatically uploaded to your Google Drive for FREE! Set it up in under 1-minute and let the iSensor HD Patio Edition scare off intruders before they even think about entering your home. Previous Comments:
At Amaryllo, we design, test, and assemble all our products and accessories.  Over the past few months, we've been trying to improve the robustness of the casing for the iSensor HD.
All Patio editions will be pre-sealed at our facilities before shipment.
*Although possible, we urge you not to open the casing as it may compromise the gaskets and rubber seals resulting in leakage.

In the video below, you can see a couple of tests we conducted on the water resistant capabilities of the iSensor HD.  We had no leakage at all on our final tests and feel very comfortable with going into production very soon.
In the video below, we test the functionality of the iSensor HD in extreme cold.  We concluded that the cold has little to no effect on the ability to pan nor does it affect the video quality.
The iSensor HD is the world's smallest remote control home security camera!
The iSensor HD Patio updates you with what's happening on the outside of your home.  Keeping an eye on your front door, pool, garden, or even watching over your pets has never been easier!
Warnings Lights, Alarms, HD Video, Free Cloud Storage, 240° Viewing, and a Weather-Resistant Exterior,
The iSensor HD Patio is just what you're looking for!
The iSensor HD can be remotely panned 170° via your mobile device, and together with a 70° lens, it has a 240° range of view with no distortion.
iSensor HD Patio has built-in motion and audio sensors. Once triggered, it will automatically send you a push text and/or push picture alert.
The push messages include a time stamp, so you know exactly when the alert was triggered.
After selecting one of the push notifications on the phone as shown above, you will be redirected to our application where you will see the chosen snapshot, as shown below.
After exiting out of the snapshot, you will see a chronological history of all your snapshot alerts, as shown below.
Here's a still image of another iSensor HD placed inside a restaurant.  As you can see, the image keeps its integrity without visual distortion.
You can view this camera at www.live.amaryllo.eu
Below are screeshots of our competitor's HD cameras.

Some are very heavily distorted, like the one below.  The reason for this is because most cameras are fixed and don't pan.  So in order to maximize the viewing area with a ""fish-eye"" lens, image quality must be sacraficed.
This one is better than the last, however you can still see lines that are distorted when they should be straight.  The contrast is also not right.
The screenshot below, also has heavy distortion and color issues.
Finally, below there are quite a few things that are inferior to Amaryllo products.
1. The frames per second is at 3! This means the stream will be extremely choppy, and the lag time will be unbearable.
2. The contrast is all wrong.  It looks black and white even in a completely lit environment.
3. The lens angle is very narrow.
The Patio edition comes standard with a 4GB built in memory, however we decided to upgrade it to 32GB for our super early backers and to 16GB for our early backers.
Package includes a 2-meter-long AC power adapter
An optional ultra-high powered white LED light warns intruders that they are being watched and also provides extra light to capture the image of the culprit
1. For viewing your personal cameras via PC

Below are screenshots of the ""my private cameras"" page which allows you to access all your cameras via PC.  Even the 2way audio, alerts, remote control, and other functions are available through Amaryllo Live.
Below is an example of how you can view all your cameras at once on Amaryllo Live.  Previously, features like these were only available for expensive professional security systems.
2. For sharing cameras with the public
Below are examples of the public channels available at Amaryllo Live

Below is a screenshot of a local restaurant that has a public camera.  You can follow, like, and share any public camera on social media.  On the right side you'll see a chat section where you can ask questions and make comments.
Below is a snap shot of that same restaurant seen on a 24"" screen.
Below is a video showing how you can move the camera in any direction. It's super convenient and easy to control.
Feel free to try out Amaryllo Live on your own PC with Firefox browser:

The latest in P2P connectivity...Amaryllo is the first company to integrate Google's browser-based real time communication service into actual products. WebRTC offers extremely stable audio and video streaming without the need of downloading software add-ons or plug-ins.
Google Drive Free Cloud Storage Support
Amaryllo is also the first company to offer free cloud storage to consumers.
Through the application, you can link your Google Drive to your camera.
Although the video is stored in your drive, you can manage and access them right through the app.  This saves you time and energy when searching for a video.
We have filed close to 20 patents to protect our designs and technologies.  Below is the iSensor HD's industry design patent granted by 26 European countries and the United States of America.
Amaryllo products were chosen out of 20,000 to win an innovation award in the embedded technology category.
Amaryllo was selected as a Cool Vendor by Gartner in their 2014 Connected Home Report . Gartner is the world's biggest investment research company.
The iSensor HD was the recipient of a Best Choice Award at Computex 2014.
Amaryllo is the recipient of the 2015 WebRTC World Product of the Year Award.
The iCamPRO FHD is the World's First Domestic Robot With Auto-Tracking
How do I set it up?
We plan to have the setup procedure for the iSensor HD Patio the same as all our other products.
The whole process takes only 1 minute if you know your WiFi password.  Our app will guide you through the steps with a simple QR code scan.
Here is the instructional video for the iSensor HD:
What is the quality of the video?
The quality comes in HD, VGA or QVGA.
For recorded videos it depends on what quality you want the camera to use. This can easily be changed in the settings menu.

For the live viewing, the camera will automatically select the most appropriate quality based on your wifi bandwidth availability.  It will also adjust the quality to make sure the connection is stable and has minimal delay.
Is there a warranty and user manual?
Yes, there is a paper manual that helps you through the setup procedures, but the digital user manual covers all other questions.
We offer warranty on parts for one year after purchase.
What kind of WiFi connection speed do I need?
Our Cameras have built-in WiFi 802.11 bgn and both downloading and uploading speeds depend on your available bandwidth.
For HD, a minimum bandwidth of 1.7Mbps is recommended.
How long can I record video?
